results.title: That's farming
results.creator_credit: Michael Burston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Michael Burston, leaving the city and taking up farming full time was a gradual process, and one not without obstacles. From virulent weeds to natural disasters, Burston was determined to pull through.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Burston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
In 1860 Robert Burke and a party of explorers began the first overland crossing of Australia from Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria. Both Burke and Wills perished on the way back. The film reconstructs the events that led to their deaths. This film is suitable for Years 7-12.
results.description:

results.title: It's time to go
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Drought : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.
results.description: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.

results.title: Roald Amundsen
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Dramatization of Roald Amundsen’s victory over England’s Captrain Robert Smith in their 1911 race to the South Pole, the last terrestrial frontier. Beautifully filmed with great use of re-enactments and voice-overs. Narrated by David Attenborough.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cobham, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Fred Burnley, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Challenge to mankind
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Five world-renowned authorities voice their opinion on the threat to mankind of overpopulation, and tender some possible solutions. Views are expressed by Madam Pandit of India, Paul Hoffman of the United States, Lord Boyd Orr of the United Kingdom, Dr Victor Belaunde of Peru and Dr Hugh Keenleyside of Canada. Animation by Rene Jodoin and Kaj Pindal. Narrated by Stanley Burke.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: People by the billions
results.creator_credit: Donald Faser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Examines the implications of the population explosion, showing that “standing room only” on our planet may become a possibility as the human race increases. A fanciful notion today, migration to another planet may hold the only hope five hundred years from now.

results.title: Man and his resources
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
What is the responsibility of the “haves” towards the “have nots”? This film examines the growing determination of the poor of the world not to remain poor, and the great twentieth-century concept of shared skills and mutual aid.
